#Text=English court jails policeman over insurance fraud
#Text=Thursday , July 1 , 2010
#Text=A court in England , UK has jailed a policeman for ten months after he was convicted of defrauding his car insurance company .
#Text=Police Constable Simon Hood , 43 , arranged for a friend who dealt in scrap metal to dispose of his Audi TT , then claimed it had been stolen .
#Text=Hood had been disappointed with the car 's value when he tried to sell it two years after its purchase in 2008 .
#Text=He arranged for friend Peter Marsh , 41 , to drive the vehicle to his scrapyard in Great Yarmouth , Norfolk .
#Text=Marsh then dismantled the vehicle with the intent of disposing of it , but parts were later found wrapped in bubblewrap at Ace Tyre and Exhaust Centre .
#Text=Audi TT
#Text=Image : IFCAR .
#Text=Marsh picked up the TT from outside nearby Gorleston police station .
#Text=Records show mobile phone conversations between the conspirators that day in March , both before and after the vehicle was reported stolen .
#Text=The pair denied wrongdoing but were convicted of conspiring to commit insurance fraud after trial .
#Text=The fraud was uncovered after Hood told former girlfriend Suzanne Coates of the scheme .
#Text=It was alleged before Norwich Crown Court that he had confessed to her in an effort to resume their relationship .
#Text=Coates said that after the pseudotheft , Hood told her " he did n't want to look for it .

#Text=Clare said Hood had resigned from the police after fifteen years of otherwise good service and risked losing his pension .

_	_	_	_

#Text=It is not a case where his position as a police officer was used in order to facilitate the fraud ,  he pointed out .

column1: #Text=Hood is now pursuing a career in plumbing .
#Text=Potts defended Marsh by saying that he , too , had already suffered from his actions .
#Text=His own insurers are refusing to renew their contract with him when it expires and his bank withdrew its overdraft facility .
#Text=His business employs 21 people and Potts cited Marsh 's sponsorship of Great Yarmouth In Bloom as amongst evidence he supported his local community .
#Text=Judge Alasdair Darroch told Marsh that he did accept the man was attempting to help his friend .
#Text=He sentenced Marsh to six months imprisonment , suspended for two years and ordered to carry out 250 hours of community service .
#Text=He was more critical of Hood :
#Text=" As a police officer you know the highest possible standards are demanded by the public .
